thread.title: UVa Football Drops ACC Opener 26-19 at Pittsburgh
thread.title_full: UVa Football Drops ACC Opener 26-19 at Pittsburgh

title: UVa Football Drops ACC Opener 26-19 at Pittsburgh
text: UVa Football Drops ACC Opener 26-19 at Pittsburgh - NBC29 WVIR Charlottesville, VA News, Sports and Weather Member Center: UVa Football Drops ACC Opener 26-19 at Pittsburgh Posted: Updated: PITTSBURGH, PA (WVIR) - The UVa football team had the ball and a chance to tie at the end of the game, but a Matt Johns pass for T.J. Thorpe on 4th down was batted away, and the Cavaliers lost their ACC opener 26-19 at Pittsburgh. Virginia (1-4, 0-1 ACC) hasn't won a road game since beating NC State 33-6 in Raleigh on November 3rd, 2012. Johns completed 17-of-33 passes for 209 yards and a touchdown against the Panthers, while Thorpe led the team with five receptions for 70 yards. Albert Reid had a team-high 74 yards rushing, with 71 yards coming on one play. UVa fell behind 17-3 in the 1st quarter, but Kwontie Moore returned a fumble 15 yards for a TD in the 2nd quarter to cut the deficit to seven. Pittsburgh sacked Johns in the endzone for a safety to go up 26-13 early in the 4th quarter, and a Johns-to-Canaan Severin touchdown with 5:50 to play provided the final margin. The team stats were remarkably similar, as Pitt had 222 yards passing and 141 rushing, while UVa had 209 and 139. Both teams had sixteen first downs, and the Panthers edged the 'Hoos in time of possession 30:21 to 29:39 Virginia will be back in action against Syracuse next Saturday. Kickoff is set for 3:30 PM. UVa Football Drops ACC Opener 26-19 at Pittsburgh More>>
